page.title: 08FARMING IN HULCOTE & SALFORD
page.content: Continuation for Farming 1. A start is then made to prepare for the next harvest with powerful and efficient ploughs. During the growing period crops are sprayed from the air by light aircraft using pesticide in order to kill pests and herbicide to increase growth. Some farmers do cut hedgerows out to accommodate modern machinery. The removal of hedgerows in this district has not been widely carried out and there are still some ancient hedgerows two to three hundred years old which are still intact and flourishing. One small farm is an animal sanctuary, a home for unwanted and lost domestic animals.
